timeline.bodyText:
From previous PR, notes from @karlmdavis

The application's configuration is all currently handled by the SpringConfiguration class. If you look, you can note that several of the properties in there are injected via environment variables.
I think you should probably remove this class, and just use something new in SpringConfiguration, instead.

Feels like a great suggestion, so we don't duplicate how / where we are supplying app configuration. I was previously unaware of this piece of the code. Here's a link to the relevant code: 
  
    
      beneficiary-fhir-data/apps/bfd-server/bfd-server-war/src/main/java/gov/cms/bfd/server/war/SpringConfiguration.java
    
    
         Line 50
      in
      af23b39
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public class SpringConfiguration {
timeline.author: jzulim

timeline.author: jzulim

timeline.bodyText: I would consider naming this file simply BeneficiaryTransformer.java - as it already resides in the r4 folder.
timeline.author: jzulim

replies.bodyText: Based on BFD v2 RFC, we have decided to have FHIR/HAPI version specific Resource providers and Transformers.
replies.author: dshekhar18

timeline.bodyText: Same as above, I would consider removing version indicators from the filenames.
timeline.author: jzulim

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * This FHIR {@link IResourceProvider} adds support for STU3 {@link Patient} resources, derived from
          
          
            
             * This FHIR {@link IResourceProvider} adds support for R4 {@link Patient} resources, derived from
timeline.author: jzulim

timeline.bodyText:
Another useful suggestion from @karlmdavis , pulled from previous PR:

Personally, I'd disagree: this should be modified in both RestfulServer implementations. It's entirely possible that we will never touch this code again: if we don't clean things up as we encounter them, who will? We should always strive to leave things a little better than we found them.
In this specific case, I don't see why a backend API like BFD needs CORS headers at all? I'd ask in #bfd-users and see if anyone objects to us removing it.
timeline.author: jzulim

replies.bodyText: CORS Headers removed since BFD is a backend API.
replies.author: dshekhar18

timeline.bodyText: I'd stick with the "v1" and "v2" naming here, too.
timeline.author: jzulim

replies.bodyText: We are talking of FHIR resources, so STU3, R4, R5 etc. V1, V2, V3 etc will facade the specific FHIR and HAPI version (or any other FHIR framework) for external partners.
replies.author: dshekhar18

replies.bodyText: I have renamed the FHIR servers as v1 and v2 from STU3 and R4.
replies.author: dshekhar18

timeline.author: jzulim
